description: A brass casing for a 9×19mm cartridge.  This one had been fired, and needs depriming and cleaning before you can reload it safely.  Deconstruct to deprime it.

notes: though the casing is not uniformly-cylindrical and has a cavity, we assume that
(1) the difference in diameter between body and rim of the casing is enough to cover the lip space
(2) nothing's going to fit into the casing
(even though both of these cases are obviously false)

description: A brass casing for a 9×19mm cartridge.  This one had been fired and subsequently deprimed.  After proper cleaning, it would be fit for handloading.
//weight: weight of used casing (3999 mg) - weight of small pistol primer (214 mg)

description: A brass casing for a 9×19mm cartridge.  This one had previously been fired, but since then has been deprimed and cleaned.  Can be reloaded into a usable cartridge, but due to the micro-scale structural damage suffered from the first firing, it cannot be used for higher-tier custom loads reliably.

A brass casing for a 9×19mm cartridge.  Of pristine quality, this casing has likely been cast in a factory but never loaded or used.  As such, it's capable of sustaining a higher pressure, and can thus be used to reliably load custom higher-tier cartridges.
